sentences.english: During the first half of this year, the country added a total of 26 million new Internet users.
sentences.chinese: 在今年的上半年，全國的網民增加了兩千六百萬。

sentences.english: Local media and netizens have hence nicknamed Liu a "nisemusume" or "pseudo girl.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後，他被當地媒體和網民冠以“僞娘”稱號。

sentences.english: The images of women barefoot on the street, handcuffed and tied to a rope, enraged internet users.
sentences.chinese: 被繩子綁住的婦女赤腳走在街上的畫面激怒了網民。

sentences.english: Computer really hypnotizes everybody,there are more and more netters now.
sentences.chinese: 計算機確實令每一個人着迷，現在的網民越來越多了。

sentences.english: The overwhelming majority of the internet voter support the new holliday policy.
sentences.chinese: 壓倒多數的網民投票支持新的假日政策。

sentences.english: Netizens laughed at it since FC Barcelona and AC Milan are football clubs.
sentences.chinese: 由於兩家都是足球俱樂部，此話一出即惹來網民嘲笑。

sentences.english: Some users have suggested that rebels had infiltrated the city.
sentences.chinese: 一些網民認爲反對派已經滲透進了該城市。

sentences.english: Chinese netizens actively engage in discussions that could directly affect companies.
sentences.chinese: 中國網民的積極參與並討論，將直接對企業產生影響。

sentences.english: Anonymous is a cultural phenomenon which began on internet image boards.
sentences.chinese: 匿名網民是源自互聯網圖形登錄的一種文化現象。

sentences.english: Another predicted, 'Shanghai Disneyland is likely to become a 'chicken rib' [an expression for something insignificant].
sentences.chinese: 另外一位網民預測，上海迪士尼樂園很可能成爲雞肋。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, in Guangzhou, where the company set up an office just months ago, Google employees said that they hadn’t received any flowers from Chinese Web users.
sentences.chinese: 廣州谷歌剛剛成立幾個月，他們說還沒收到網民獻花。

sentences.english: Millions of Internet users made online comments on major news portals to show their grief.
sentences.chinese: 在各大新聞門戶網上，數百萬網民在線留言以寄哀思。

sentences.english: As the Internet grows, so do the number of net-citizens.
sentences.chinese: 隨着互聯網的增長，網民數量也隨之增加。

sentences.english: Do you think this meeting perplexes general netizen?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲這會困擾一般的網民嗎？

sentences.english: Internet users have voted overwhelmingly in favor of new holidays.
sentences.chinese: 壓倒多數的網民投票支持新的假日政策。

sentences.english: He became well-known for his announcement. He described his relationship with his lover Sun.
sentences.chinese: 面對中國大陸網民，他講述了自己與愛人小陽的關係。

definition: bean vermicelli/mung bean starch noodles/Chinese vermicelli/cellophane noodles/CL:把[ba3]/fan (loanword)/enthusiast for sb or sth
to be present/to be on the scene
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
to issue a document/document issued by an authority/outgoing messages/(Internet) to post an article online
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to listen/to hear what sb says/news one has heard
